LLMInstructions.description:
You are given: 1. A list of existing lists, each with a "ListName" and "CreateDescription". 2. A candidate list with a "ListName" and "CreateDescription".
Your job is to decide if the candidate list already exists among the existing lists. - If it exists, return: { "found": true, "foundListName": "The matching list's name" } - Otherwise return: { "found": false, "foundListName": "" }

instructions.instruction: You may decide if it "exists" based on an exact match of ListName, or you can also consider a match based on the CreateDescription if it covers similar content. If you find a suitable match, set "found"=true and "foundListName" to the matched name. If you find no match, set "found"=false and "foundListName"="".

LLMInstructions.formatNotes: 1. Your final output must be valid JSON. 2. The required keys are: "found" (boolean) and "foundListName" (string). 3. No extra keys or text is allowed.
